name: Fantastic flat in Edinburgh, EH3.
summary: Fantastic 1st floor apartment (parking) in the cosmopolitan and popular area of Stockbridge, 15 min walk from Princes Street. It is packed with artisan shops, quirky, trendy eateries and bars which are 5 mins walk from the flat. Ideal for couples and families.
space: The flat comfortably fits 2 guests or couples with a baby. High chair provided.
description: Fantastic 1st floor apartment (parking) in the cosmopolitan and popular area of Stockbridge, 15 min walk from Princes Street. It is packed with artisan shops, quirky, trendy eateries and bars which are 5 mins walk from the flat. Ideal for couples and families. The flat comfortably fits 2 guests or couples with a baby. High chair provided. Guests will be met on arrival by Fiona or Duncan. We will be available to assist guests with any problems or to help with planning their stay to make the most of their visit to Edinburgh. Fiona is a teacher of English as a Foreign Language and also a trained Opera singer and she would be very happy to help in either of those areas! Stockbridge is the highly desirable "village within the City"  and has much to offer the visitor from its' quirky cobbled streets to near by parks and gardens and the tranquil Water of Leith. There is a huge choice of bars, restaurants and cafes to suit all budgets and tastes. There are artisan shops alongside mini supermar
neighborhood_overview: Stockbridge is the highly desirable "village within the City"  and has much to offer the visitor from its' quirky cobbled streets to near by parks and gardens and the tranquil Water of Leith. There is a huge choice of bars, restaurants and cafes to suit all budgets and tastes. There are artisan shops alongside mini supermarkets for all provisions and there is also a friendly Sunday market! It is 15 min walk to the City Centre and the main museums, theatres and galleries.
notes: The apartment is situated on the first floor of a modern block set in landscaped grounds with private parking. The flat has windows facing Glenogle Road and also overlooking the quiet courtyard to the rear. There are a total of 6 flats in the block and the main door has a secure entry com system.
transit: The 23 bus stop is 3 minute walk from the flat taking you straight to Princes Street which is the world famous street with Edinburgh Castle. You can alternatively walk to Princes Street in 15 minutes from the flat. Stockbridge is a 5 minute walk along the quaint Colonies on Glenogle Road. Glenogle Road has a public gym available. Taxis are readily available and cost around £7 to the city centre.
access: Guests will be met on arrival by Fiona or Duncan.
interaction: We will be available to assist guests with any problems or to help with planning their stay to make the most of their visit to Edinburgh. Fiona is a teacher of English as a Foreign Language and also a trained Opera singer and she would be very happy to help in either of those areas!
house_rules: Please be respectful to the neighbours when entering and exiting the building Strictly No Smoking in the flat and common stairway Please remove shoes in the bedroom ( light coloured carpet) Strictly No parties No pets

neighborhood_overview: Spring Gardens is appealing because it has the best of both worlds:  to the south you are on the edge of the park and minutes away from the wild walks around Arthur's Seat; to the west you are ten minutes walk from Holyrood Palace and the heart of the Old Town at the bottom of end of the Royal Mile.
notes: Lift to third floor.  Communal garden downstairs very pleasant to sit in and relax.
transit: Bus from the airport to Waverley Station and five minute bus or taxi ride to flat. Buses to the town centre are five minutes walk away.  There is free parking on the road. The flat is only a five minute walk to the buses on London Road; once boarded, it's only a five minute bus ride to John Lewis, the Omni Centre and Princes Street.You can easily walk into the Old Town through the park or along the more picturesque route following Spring Gardens past Holyrood Palace and up into the Royal Mile: all told only a ten minute trip.
access: Access to kitchen for breakfast only. Breakfast is not provided but you are welcome to use kitchen to make your own. There is no dishwasher so I would ask you to wash up and put away your breakfast dishes.
interaction: We are on hand to give help, advice and information on Edinburgh and Scotland for touring, eating, travelling.
house_rules: Kitchen for breakfast only between 7-9:30am. No smoking.  Close door on entering and leaving room to avoid slamming (sprung doors). Remember to lock the flat door when you leave the flat and check outside door fully closed.
host_about: I am a photographer and love classical art, architecture and literature. I teach English.  I like to travel in and around the Mediterranean.

space: Our flat is cosy but spacious enough to feel comfortable, there is wifi, sky TV, heating and all amenities you could need.  The only thing the flat misses is a washing machine, however we are located above a launderette should you need it.

host_about: I am a Nurse living in Edinburgh with my boyfriend Scott.  We both enjoy sports and traveling as much as we can both in Scotland and abroad.  We are happy to both be self sufficiant when staying in airbnb or available for any questions and help when hosting.  We are easy going and relaxed but expect respect for our property and posessions like we would be to others.  We have a very central 2 bedroom flat situated on Leith Walk.  The bus connections are excellent and you can go direct to City centre for shopping, the Castle and other tourist attractions as well as Ocean Terminal by the harbour where the Royal Brotannia is located aswell as shops, restaurants and cinema.  All these ammenities are within 20 min bus journey, 15 mins to town or a 25 min walk.  The Shore which is just as close hosts a number of restaurants and bars some of which are michelin star such as Tom Kitchin and Martin Wishart.  Beside the flat itself is a local Scotmid, Italian restaurant directly opposite which is highly recommended for sit in or take away and a number of other quirky bars, cafes and restaurants.  The flat is a cosy 2 double bedrooms with a open plan kitchen/living room.  There is a bathroom with bath/ shower and combi boiler for heating if required.
street: C Leith Walk, Edinburgh, EH6 5BR, United Kingdom

name: Traditional Central Double room incl. Breakfast
summary: This is a large light attractive double room with a combination of original features and modern comforts.  Period features include wooden flooring and window bay along with the high ceiling, cornicing, antique(?) furniture and a matching chesterfield sofa.  The room is warm and comfortable, especially the bed, and the double window affords views over the city. A lovely central location from which to enjoy Edinburgh.
space: THE FLAT: Warm, friendly and relaxed environment. That's the most important thing about this flat; how well those of us who live here get along. Mostly it's quiet, our place away from the rest of the world - we like reading, cooking and watching movies. It's the kind of place where you check if anyone needs to use the bathroom before jumping in the shower for 20 minutes. If that sounds like you please read on… This is a carefully modernised traditional Edinburgh tenement flat built in the 19th century. Its architecture, decor and comfort combine to make this a very homely flat. It boasts many original features including large windows, high ceilings, cornicing, wood panelling and solid wood floors. It also offers modern creature comforts such as temperature-controlled gas central heating, unlimited hot water, double glazing, modern fitted kitchen and good quality furniture. I own a few flats and look after a few others for friends but this is a real Edinburgh home, it's my home. I bough

neighborhood_overview: LOCATION: Easter Road is great neighbourhood that i've seen go from strength to strength over the last decade. Close to the city centre but with its own identity and community. In the immediate vicinity we have the best Italian restaurant, best bakery, best off-license, my favourite pub and the best Thai food i've eaten since Bangkok. There are cool cafes, vintage shops and an award-winning local supermarket (as well a choice of big supermarkets slightly further away, perhaps 10 minutes walk). The flat is central enough that many guests walk everywhere. You will find high street shopping, restaurants, pubs, historic tourist attractions and the picturesque walks that Edinburgh is famed for. PLACES OF INTEREST: The Royal Mile is less than 1 mile away, it is the heart of Edinburgh's old town. It links Holyrood Palace (the Queen's official residence in Scotland) and the Scottish Parliament with Edinburgh Castle. Halfway up is a section called High Street which is the epicentre of street th
notes: DISCOUNTS Some discounts are applied automatically. For example, if you stay for a week you get one night free and if you stay for a month you only pay for 3 weeks. AirBnB's system is good but not perfect so I have to apply some discounts manually. In particular if more than 1 person stays in this room for a week or more then I will manually apply a discount to the price you are quoted. When you enquire about renting this room I will send you a special offer with the correct price.
transit: PUBLIC TRANSPORT: Edinburgh is a small city so many guests find they can walk everywhere they wish to visit. However, if you prefer public transport or wish to visit the attractions on Edinburgh's outskirts (such as Rosslyn, Cramond and Portobello) then a close by bus route will take you there. The buses are now GPS tracked with arrival boards at the stops and you can even download a free app to your phone to see exactly how soon the next one is arriving.
access: CAPACITY: This listing is for a private room with a double bed which will sleep 2 people comfortably.
interaction: ARRIVING: The flat is about a mile from Waverley Train Station; you can walk, catch the no.1 bus or jump in a taxi. From the airport you can catch the regular (and inexpensive) no. 35 bus which brings you all the way to the flat in about an hour. SETTLING INTO THE FLAT: I will meet you when you arrive to hand over a set of keys, show you round the flat and answer any questions you may have about the accommodation, location and Edinburgh in general. After that, well I live here so ask questions when you see me or call if i'm out. You will get my email address when your booking is confirmed and my phone number is on all the key fobs.
house_rules: No smoking in the building. Please check if anyone needs to use the bathroom before taking a shower. Please keep communal areas tidy, especially the kitchen: Wipe surfaces, put dirty dishes in the dish-washer and wash pots, etc. Please use and enjoy the home cinema carefully and put CDs away. Full instructions can be found in the house manual. If you have issues please talk to me. Be nice and enjoy your stay. That's about it.

host_about:
Hi!

About me:

My name is Adam!  I grew up in Scotland so having a laugh is definitely the most important thing to me! I also love meeting new people and sharing past experiences with them which is why I am opening my home to people on airbnb. Some of my closest friendships and also business partnerships  have come from very random circumstances - if you are funny and laid back then we will definitely get on!

I started my career as a surgical doctor before founding a health & fitness tech company. I now live between London and San Francisco. I love to travel and I have been lucky enough to visit some amazing places all over the world. I have to say that  I am very fussy about where I stay, which is why you can be sure that my home is of a high standard! I have set up my home in such a way that people can feel they are in a boutique hotel but also have some important home comforts too. As I travel so much it is the perfect way I would like to visit new places whether I was on a business trip or on holiday! 

About me as a host:

My hosting style is very relaxed and (I like to think) warm and friendly. The Scottish in me really kicks in I think! I look forward to meeting all you fun, interesting people out there and I hope you enjoy the way in which I have adapted my beautiful London Townhouse for you!

Despite being on airbnb for 2 months, I have hosted over 80 times and I have been really grateful to have met so many interesting people. I want to thank my guests for leaving such kind, warm words about me and my home.  Here are a sample of my guest reviews:

"Fabulous 4 (URL HIDDEN) our 50's. Thought it would be hard to give up our 5 star travelling days.But this gorgeous Chiswick English house generated warmth,oozed comfort, and delivered all it said it (URL HIDDEN) added extra was the charm and character of the (URL HIDDEN) nice to feel at ease and welcome.A real bonus to meet other people . Would return in a flash" Georges and Debbie

"Adam's room is even better than what the pictures show, very bright and large and in a very nice neighborhood. The location is great, in a very residential neighborhood, but with many nice restaurants around, and walking distance to the tube station. Also, Adam made me feel very welcome, gave me all the instructions and help needed. Overall, it was a very good experience! Thank you, Adam!" Betina

"Simply the best BNB experience I have had. Large clean rooms in a well organised apartment. Key code worked a dream and so much easier than meeting someone with the key when your phone does not work in that country. Also cheapest apartment in the area so what a deal to find it was a great place all round. Adam was just so friendly and professional. If I lived in that street he would be my new best friend! was a little concerned by a previous post, but I got the story from another guest (who had been there for a month! - thats how good a deal this flat it) and they told me what a nightmare this family had been and how Adam had tried to quieten them down to help the other guests and asked them to clean up their kitchen mess and then they wrote that vicous review!) ANyway, stay here. Easy walk to the Tube, amazing nightlife and real London pubs 1 minute a way, and a perfect BNB Host."

host_about:
Hi, I'm Jo.  I moved to Edinburgh 26 years ago so that my daughter could attend the Rudolf Steiner school here.  Little did i know then what a beautiful, vibrant and cultured city I'd arrived in. It really has something for everyone.
Our Festivals in the summer, especially the International and Fringe Festivals are world renowned and people flood in every August to take part and be part of.  
I'm a retired social worker who worked in both this country and overseas, my favourite being South Africa.
I now work on a voluntary basis in Tanzania and visit as often as I'm able.
This year I added in Kenya to visit and fell in love with it also. 
Come and see us in Edinburgh and I promise you will fall in love with this glorious city.......  the weather, sadly, is beyond my remit!!

host_about:
Hi!

About me:

My name is Adam!  I grew up in Scotland so having a laugh is definitely the most important thing to me! I also love meeting new people and sharing past experiences with them which is why I am opening my home to people on airbnb. Some of my closest friendships and also business partnerships  have come from very random circumstances - if you are funny and laid back then we will definitely get on!

I started my career as a surgical doctor before founding a health & fitness tech company. I now live between London and San Francisco. I love to travel and I have been lucky enough to visit some amazing places all over the world. I have to say that  I am very fussy about where I stay, which is why you can be sure that my home is of a high standard! I have set up my home in such a way that people can feel they are in a boutique hotel but also have some important home comforts too. As I travel so much it is the perfect way I would like to visit new places whether I was on a business trip or on holiday! 

About me as a host:

My hosting style is very relaxed and (I like to think) warm and friendly. The Scottish in me really kicks in I think! I look forward to meeting all you fun, interesting people out there and I hope you enjoy the way in which I have adapted my beautiful London Townhouse for you!

Despite being on airbnb for 2 months, I have hosted over 80 times and I have been really grateful to have met so many interesting people. I want to thank my guests for leaving such kind, warm words about me and my home.  Here are a sample of my guest reviews:

"Fabulous 4 (URL HIDDEN) our 50's. Thought it would be hard to give up our 5 star travelling days.But this gorgeous Chiswick English house generated warmth,oozed comfort, and delivered all it said it (URL HIDDEN) added extra was the charm and character of the (URL HIDDEN) nice to feel at ease and welcome.A real bonus to meet other people . Would return in a flash" Georges and Debbie

"Adam's room is even better than what the pictures show, very bright and large and in a very nice neighborhood. The location is great, in a very residential neighborhood, but with many nice restaurants around, and walking distance to the tube station. Also, Adam made me feel very welcome, gave me all the instructions and help needed. Overall, it was a very good experience! Thank you, Adam!" Betina

"Simply the best BNB experience I have had. Large clean rooms in a well organised apartment. Key code worked a dream and so much easier than meeting someone with the key when your phone does not work in that country. Also cheapest apartment in the area so what a deal to find it was a great place all round. Adam was just so friendly and professional. If I lived in that street he would be my new best friend! was a little concerned by a previous post, but I got the story from another guest (who had been there for a month! - thats how good a deal this flat it) and they told me what a nightmare this family had been and how Adam had tried to quieten them down to help the other guests and asked them to clean up their kitchen mess and then they wrote that vicous review!) ANyway, stay here. Easy walk to the Tube, amazing nightlife and real London pubs 1 minute a way, and a perfect BNB Host."

neighborhood_overview: Portobello is a small seaside village 4 miles outside of Edinburgh city centre. It is a good place for cyclists and walkers to visit with a cycle path running from opposite my front door to the Scottish Parliament and Holyrood Park. It has good quality local eateries and pubs whilst the city centre's attractions are also readily accessible. It is also the gateway to East Lothian's attractions e.g. Musselburgh and its racecourse and coastal towns North Berwick&Dunbar.
notes: We have a beautiful 2 year old Blue Russian cat named Mr Darcy, he is quiet and friendly and not allowed in any of our bedrooms or bathrooms but he will want to meet you so probably best not to stay here if you don't like or are allergic to cats.
transit: Train station is at the end of the street (3 minute walk) and train to Edinburgh Waverley takes 6 minutes. The cost is £3-£4 return depending on the time of day. Trains run from early in the morning until just before midnight. We will provide train timetables :-) There are also multiple buses to the city centre (£1.50 single ticket). The bus takes 20-30 minutes so we always get the train.

Hi, thanks for taking the time to look through our rooms.

The locals proudly boast that there is little to nothing you won't be able to find on this street. Or take a walk along the water of Leith right through the city center. If you don't like to walk Leith Walk it's also on the main bus route to all parts of the city therefore you can hop on any bus regularly and at any time day or night to anywhere you want to go. It's a 5 minute bus ride to Princess Street, Waverly train station.

name: Modern Family-Friendly Double w/bft
summary: Your spacious, calm & relaxing room has a comfy bed & it's own rocking chair. You share the rest of this bright, modern home with our family.  Our relaxed family home is situated a short 20 minute bus ride from the centre of Edinburgh. Breakfast inc.
space: Our home is a calm and relaxing family space.  LIVING AREA During summer months the house is filled with sunshine, during the winter we fire up the log burner and 'batten down the hatches' to create a warm and inviting communal living area. You are welcome to use this area in the morning between 7am and 9am, and in the evening between 6pm and 9pm. We are a busy family so ask that you keep to your room outside of these times in order for us to go about our daily life.  KITCHEN On a warm day you may wish to sit outside in our small garden to eat your breakfast. At other times breakfast (cereal, toast, fruit, tea, coffee, fruit juice) is available in our large, bright kitchen between 7:30am and 9:00am. If you need a highchair for breakfast please feel free to use ours.  BEDROOM The bedroom is a spacious double with a comfortable full size double bed which will be made up with white Egyptian cotton bedding. A down duvet will be provided as standard (unless you specify otherwise when bookin
description: Your spacious, calm & relaxing room has a comfy bed & it's own rocking chair. You share the rest of this bright, modern home with our family.  Our relaxed family home is situated a short 20 minute bus ride from the centre of Edinburgh. Breakfast inc. Our home is a calm and relaxing family space.  LIVING AREA During summer months the house is filled with sunshine, during the winter we fire up the log burner and 'batten down the hatches' to create a warm and inviting communal living area. You are welcome to use this area in the morning between 7am and 9am, and in the evening between 6pm and 9pm. We are a busy family so ask that you keep to your room outside of these times in order for us to go about our daily life.  KITCHEN On a warm day you may wish to sit outside in our small garden to eat your breakfast. At other times breakfast (cereal, toast, fruit, tea, coffee, fruit juice) is available in our large, bright kitchen between 7:30am and 9:00am. If you need a highchair for breakfast pl
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located on a leafy, quiet road, in the Liberton area of Edinburgh (a 20 minute bus ride from the centre of Edinburgh).   There is a very nice, upmarket food and wine shop/small supermarket a 5 minute walk from the house.  5 minutes in the other direction takes you to a larger supermarket.
transit: There are 4 bus routes running close to the house - each leave from the end of the street, approximately a 4 minute walk from our front door.  Buses take approximately 20 minutes to the centre of town. There is unlimited on street parking outside the house.   Car rental can be arranged from the centre of town, or the airport.  We are happy to help you arrange this if needed.
access: Guests have full, private access to a lovely, large double room.  In your room you will find a comfy full sized double bed, a rocking chair, storage for your belongings and a large desk/dressing table.   High speed wireless internet is available, so feel free to log-on at your leisure.  The modern bathroom is shared with our family - there is a bath and shower alongside the usual washbasin and toilet.  Guests have exclusive access to the downstairs WC.  The kitchen area is available during breakfast times - breakfast is served here between 7:30 - 9am.  Feel free to relax in the living room (TV, Wireless internet, bookcase with local information) between 6pm - 9pm. Please note that we are a busy family, and we have to prepare for the day ahead, so we ask that you keep to your room outside of these times.  We really appreciate guests sticking to this. All of our house is quiet as we are situated on a wonderfully leafy, quiet cul-de-sac, and have good quality double glazing fitted.
interaction: We will be available throughout your stay, either in person at the house, or by telephone/email contact if required.  We will be delighted to offer any advice we can about things to do locally.
house_rules: Our house rules are quite simple: PLEASE treat our house with respect - we love our home and expect guests to respect it.  This means being careful with it, and the things in it. SHOES off in the hallway please.  This protects the floor coverings and makes for a cleaner, more comfortable place for us all :-)  Feel free to bring your slippers! NO SMOKING anywhere in the house or garden.
host_about:
We are a young family living a busy (enjoyable and exciting!) life in Edinburgh with our 1.5 year old daughter.  We love spending lots of time outdoors - biking, climbing, walking - and when we are home we like relaxing, crafting, tinkering on the computer, cooking and baking.  Food is a big part of our lives!

We love travelling and experiencing new things and meeting new people - we welcome you as a guest into our home and look forward to sharing some stories and getting to know you a little bit (*we look forward to chatting with you if you are feeling sociable; if not we are more than happy to give you your own space - we know the feeling of just wanting to get to bed!).

As your hosts, we try to be as flexible and accommodating as possible - so if you choose to stay with us, please let us know if you have any special requirements.  

Life in our little house is comfortable we believe a home should be a 'cozy machine for living in' - that means that we like to make sure the space is both functional and works well both for us as a family and for you as our guest, and yet also that the space is homely and a pleasant place to spend time in.  If you stay with us, we hope you will find our place warm and welcoming.

We have also had many adventures in our lovely yellow VW T4 camper van, and our van is available to rent out on a daily basis.

summary: *Self Check-In 24/7 *Large Room *Private, with Door Locks *High-Speed Wifi *Free Breakfast  *Daily Cleaning *Kitchen, own fridge & cupboard space  *MORE ROOMS: click my picture » +More » View full » View all listing
description: *Self Check-In 24/7 *Large Room *Private, with Door Locks *High-Speed Wifi *Free Breakfast  *Daily Cleaning *Kitchen, own fridge & cupboard space  *MORE ROOMS: click my picture » +More » View full » View all listing
house_rules: No Smoking To respect the tranquility of the neighbourhood  Clean & tidy guests is must
host_about:
Hi!

About me:

My name is Adam!  I grew up in Scotland so having a laugh is definitely the most important thing to me! I also love meeting new people and sharing past experiences with them which is why I am opening my home to people on airbnb. Some of my closest friendships and also business partnerships  have come from very random circumstances - if you are funny and laid back then we will definitely get on!

I started my career as a surgical doctor before founding a health & fitness tech company. I now live between London and San Francisco. I love to travel and I have been lucky enough to visit some amazing places all over the world. I have to say that  I am very fussy about where I stay, which is why you can be sure that my home is of a high standard! I have set up my home in such a way that people can feel they are in a boutique hotel but also have some important home comforts too. As I travel so much it is the perfect way I would like to visit new places whether I was on a business trip or on holiday! 

About me as a host:

My hosting style is very relaxed and (I like to think) warm and friendly. The Scottish in me really kicks in I think! I look forward to meeting all you fun, interesting people out there and I hope you enjoy the way in which I have adapted my beautiful London Townhouse for you!

Despite being on airbnb for 2 months, I have hosted over 80 times and I have been really grateful to have met so many interesting people. I want to thank my guests for leaving such kind, warm words about me and my home.  Here are a sample of my guest reviews:

"Fabulous 4 (URL HIDDEN) our 50's. Thought it would be hard to give up our 5 star travelling days.But this gorgeous Chiswick English house generated warmth,oozed comfort, and delivered all it said it (URL HIDDEN) added extra was the charm and character of the (URL HIDDEN) nice to feel at ease and welcome.A real bonus to meet other people . Would return in a flash" Georges and Debbie

"Adam's room is even better than what the pictures show, very bright and large and in a very nice neighborhood. The location is great, in a very residential neighborhood, but with many nice restaurants around, and walking distance to the tube station. Also, Adam made me feel very welcome, gave me all the instructions and help needed. Overall, it was a very good experience! Thank you, Adam!" Betina

"Simply the best BNB experience I have had. Large clean rooms in a well organised apartment. Key code worked a dream and so much easier than meeting someone with the key when your phone does not work in that country. Also cheapest apartment in the area so what a deal to find it was a great place all round. Adam was just so friendly and professional. If I lived in that street he would be my new best friend! was a little concerned by a previous post, but I got the story from another guest (who had been there for a month! - thats how good a deal this flat it) and they told me what a nightmare this family had been and how Adam had tried to quieten them down to help the other guests and asked them to clean up their kitchen mess and then they wrote that vicous review!) ANyway, stay here. Easy walk to the Tube, amazing nightlife and real London pubs 1 minute a way, and a perfect BNB Host."
street: Edinburgh, Edinburgh, Scotland EH4 8AH, United Kingdom

interaction: I will be there to greet you of course and show you around, let you know where to find everything and make the most of your stay in the city. house_rules: No house rules, come and go as you please, but this is a quiet, clean living home, so I just ask that you keep a tidy space, respect my property and are mindful of the neighbours in terms of the noise.
host_about:
I am a busy fitness professional & presenter traveling the world teaching instructor trainings & masterclasses, presenting at various events. I also run my own wellness company through which I do Reiki, Meditation, Empowerment workshops & more.  
I love soaking up the different cultures and working with people from so many countries!
Before that, I was a performer, a singer/actor/dancer working in theatre, voiceover & TV in the UK and US for a time.
I work from home in the week and weekends are spent working away.  I love being based in Edinburgh, it's a great city and I've made my apartment a wonderful space to return to and for me to relax in, so it has a nice, chilled vibe for your stay!
Look forward to meeting you!

name: Charming Flat close to City Centre
summary: This is a warm, cosy and slightly quirky 2 bedroom tenement flat.  It's close to city centre, particularly the old town, university and major Fringe venues.  It sleeps 6 people comfortably when using the living room sofa-bed and can sleep 8 if required.
space: THE FLAT: This is a traditional Edinburgh tenement flat built in the 19th century. It has been recently refurbished with a top-of-the-line Vaillant gas central heating and hot water system.  High tech temperature controlled heating and unlimited hot water.  We also fitted a Bosch freezer and dish washer in the old water tank cupboard beside the kitchen.  Finally we fitted decent carpets and underlay throughout. BRAND NEW BATHROOM: The bathroom always let this down so we've fitted a brand new one.  Gleaming white tiles, high tech slate effect floor (warm, grippy and looks great), chrome towel rail, vanity sink with waterfall tap and an awesome shower fed from the Vaillant boiler.  Photos to follow soon, Ratcliffe Terrace is a short walk from the Meadows and the Old Town (the centre of Edinburgh is divided into the New Town and the historic Old Town).  If you don't fancy walking then the award-winning local bus service runs dozens of buses an hour. They include the no.42 and 67 which bot

neighborhood_overview: LOCATION: Abbeyhill / Easter Road is great neighbourhood that i've seen go from strength to strength over the last decade. Close to the city centre but with its own identity and community. In the immediate vicinity we have the best Italian restaurant, best bakery, best off-license, my favourite pub and the best Thai food i've eaten since Bangkok. There are cool cafes, vintage shops and even a big Sainsburys hidden just round the corner. The flat is so central that many guests walk everywhere. The short stroll into town along Regent Road is one of the best views in Edinburgh. On route you will pass Calton Hill which offers the best view of central Edinburgh. You will find high street shopping, restaurants, pubs, historic tourist attractions and the picturesque walks that Edinburgh is famed for. PLACES OF INTEREST: Bristo Square in the Old Town is the hub of the commercial Fringe (Gilded Balloon, Pleasance, Underbelly, etc.). It is about a mile away, walk or catch the 67 bus from just ou
notes: DISCOUNTS & CHARGES Some discounts are applied automatically. For example, if you stay for a week you get one night free and if you stay for a month you only pay for 3 weeks. AirBnB's system is good but not perfect so I have to apply some discounts manually. In particular if more than 4 people people stay in this flat for a week or more then I will manually apply a discount to the price you are quoted. When you enquire about renting this flat I will send you a special offer with the correct price. Similarly, if you want an extra bed and bedding to be provided beyond the 2 included beds there is a one-off charge that I will apply manually. Regardless the length of your stay bedding for the sofa-bed and the spare mattress cost £10 each.
transit: PUBLIC TRANSPORT: Edinburgh is a small city so many guests find they can walk everywhere they wish to visit. However, if you prefer public transport or wish to visit the attractions on Edinburgh's outskirts (such as Rosslyn, Cramond and Portobello) then a close by bus route will take you there. The buses are now GPS tracked with arrival boards at the stops and you can even download a free app to your phone to see exactly how soon the next one is arriving.
access: CAPACITY: This listing is for the whole flat which has 2 bedrooms with dedicated beds for 4 people. The living / dining room is furnished with a sofabed and bedding can be provided for a small additional fee. This allows up to 6 people to stay in the flat comfortably.  There is also a spare mattress which makes sleeping 8 people possible but rather crowded.
interaction: ARRIVING: The flat is 1.5 miles from Waverley Train Station; you can walk, catch the no.67 bus from The Mound or jump in a taxi. From the airport you can catch the 100 bus to Princes Street and then change to the no.67 bus on The Mound or catch a taxi. SETTLING INTO THE FLAT: I will meet you when you arrive to hand over 2 or 3 sets of keys, show you round the flat and answer any questions you may have about the accommodation, location and Edinburgh in general. After that you're welcome to call or email if you have any queries or issues but I will leave you to enjoy the flat in private. You will get my email address when your booking is confirmed and my phone number is on all the key fobs. I am available 24/7 for emergencies and 11am - 11pm for general questions.
house_rules: NO smoking inside the flat or stairwell.  If you have to smoke please go outside. Please check if anyone needs to use the bathroom before taking a bath or shower. Please keep the flat reasonably tidy and do your washing up before leaving. Please be courteous and don't disturb the neighbours or other guests. Report any issues promptly so we can sort them out. Pets are only allowed if cleared with myself in advance, a security deposit is paid and they do not damage anything. If you have problems or questions call me on (phone number hidden) - I live across town on Easter Road so can be at the flat in 20 minutes if needed. Be nice and enjoy your stay.
host_about:
Hello, I'm Zeb.

I'm a 38 years old graduate.  I divide my year between organising music festivals, teaching massage and travelling.  When not working I play squash, listen to music, watch movies and read a lot.  Also enjoy DIY and have done a lot of work on my flat over the last few years - it's now a really comfortable place to spend time.  I like my home to be quietly sociable and welcoming, if that sounds good to you please come and stay here.
street: Ratcliffe Terrace, Edinburgh, EH9 1ST, United Kingdom

host_about:
Hi!

About me:

My name is Adam!  I grew up in Scotland so having a laugh is definitely the most important thing to me! I also love meeting new people and sharing past experiences with them which is why I am opening my home to people on airbnb. Some of my closest friendships and also business partnerships  have come from very random circumstances - if you are funny and laid back then we will definitely get on!

I started my career as a surgical doctor before founding a health & fitness tech company. I now live between London and San Francisco. I love to travel and I have been lucky enough to visit some amazing places all over the world. I have to say that  I am very fussy about where I stay, which is why you can be sure that my home is of a high standard! I have set up my home in such a way that people can feel they are in a boutique hotel but also have some important home comforts too. As I travel so much it is the perfect way I would like to visit new places whether I was on a business trip or on holiday! 

About me as a host:

My hosting style is very relaxed and (I like to think) warm and friendly. The Scottish in me really kicks in I think! I look forward to meeting all you fun, interesting people out there and I hope you enjoy the way in which I have adapted my beautiful London Townhouse for you!

Despite being on airbnb for 2 months, I have hosted over 80 times and I have been really grateful to have met so many interesting people. I want to thank my guests for leaving such kind, warm words about me and my home.  Here are a sample of my guest reviews:

"Fabulous 4 (URL HIDDEN) our 50's. Thought it would be hard to give up our 5 star travelling days.But this gorgeous Chiswick English house generated warmth,oozed comfort, and delivered all it said it (URL HIDDEN) added extra was the charm and character of the (URL HIDDEN) nice to feel at ease and welcome.A real bonus to meet other people . Would return in a flash" Georges and Debbie

"Adam's room is even better than what the pictures show, very bright and large and in a very nice neighborhood. The location is great, in a very residential neighborhood, but with many nice restaurants around, and walking distance to the tube station. Also, Adam made me feel very welcome, gave me all the instructions and help needed. Overall, it was a very good experience! Thank you, Adam!" Betina

"Simply the best BNB experience I have had. Large clean rooms in a well organised apartment. Key code worked a dream and so much easier than meeting someone with the key when your phone does not work in that country. Also cheapest apartment in the area so what a deal to find it was a great place all round. Adam was just so friendly and professional. If I lived in that street he would be my new best friend! was a little concerned by a previous post, but I got the story from another guest (who had been there for a month! - thats how good a deal this flat it) and they told me what a nightmare this family had been and how Adam had tried to quieten them down to help the other guests and asked them to clean up their kitchen mess and then they wrote that vicous review!) ANyway, stay here. Easy walk to the Tube, amazing nightlife and real London pubs 1 minute a way, and a perfect BNB Host."

name: Bright warm beautiful central flat
summary: This is a wonderful flat packed full of charm and character.  South facing so bright and warm with spectacular views of Arthur's Seat.  Beautifully presented and close to the city centre.  It can comfortably sleep 6 people, a great place from which to enjoy Edinburgh.
space: THE FLAT: This is a carefully modernised traditional Edinburgh tenement flat built in the 19th century. Its architecture, decor, view and overall feel combine to make this a very special flat. In fact it's a listed building, the only one in the area as far as i'm aware. It boasts many original features including large windows, high ceilings, cornicing, wood panelling and even the old mechanical doorbell. It also boasts modern creature comforts such as gas central heating and unlimited hot water on demand from a combi-boiler, double glazing, modern fitted kitchen and bathroom, and good quality beds. Best of all this flat is south facing with no other buildings close by. I've never seen a shadow fall on it even in winter so it's always bright. This is a real Edinburgh home, a perfect base close to the city centre. I love this flat - one day it will be my home but I can't yet afford to live here so it's available for you to enjoy. Albion Road is walking distance (about a mile) from Prince

neighborhood_overview: LOCATION: Easter Road is great neighbourhood that i've seen go from strength to strength over the last decade.  Close to the city centre but with its own identity and community.  In the immediate vicinity we have the best Italian restaurant, best bakery, best off-license, my favourite pub and the best Thai food i've eaten since Bangkok.  There are cool cafes, vintage shops and an award-winning local supermarket (as well a choice of big supermarkets slightly further away, perhaps 10 minutes walk). The flat is central enough that many guests walk everywhere.  You will find high street shopping, restaurants, pubs, historic tourist attractions and the picturesque walks that Edinburgh is famed for. PLACES OF INTEREST: The Royal Mile is less than 1 mile away, it is the heart of Edinburgh's old town.  It links Holyrood Palace (the Queen's official residence in Scotland) and the Scottish Parliament with Edinburgh Castle.  Halfway up is a section called High Street which is the epicentre of str
notes: DISCOUNTS & CHARGES Some discounts are applied automatically.  For example, if you stay for a week you get one night free and if you stay for a month you only pay for 3 weeks.  AirBnB's system is good but not perfect so I have to apply some discounts manually.  In particular if more than 4 people people stay in this flat for a week or more then I will manually apply a discount to the price you are quoted.   When you enquire about renting this flat I will send you a special offer with the correct price.  Similarly, if you want an extra bed and bedding to be provided beyond the 2 included beds there is a one-off charge that I will apply manually.  Regardless the length of your stay an extra single bed and bedding costs £15 while a double bed and bedding costs £25.
transit: PUBLIC TRANSPORT: Edinburgh is a small city so many guests find they can walk everywhere they wish to visit.  However, if you prefer public transport or wish to visit the attractions on Edinburgh's outskirts (such as Rosslyn, Cramond and Portobello) then a close by bus route will take you there.  The buses are now GPS tracked with arrival boards at the stops and you can even download a free app to your phone to see exactly how soon the next one is arriving.
access: CAPACITY: This listing is for the whole flat which has 2 bedrooms with dedicated beds for 4 people. The living / dining room is spacious enough to fit another bed which can be provided for a small additional fee. This allows up to 6 people to stay in the flat comfortably.
interaction: ARRIVING: The flat is about a mile from Waverley Train Station; you can walk, catch the no.1 bus or jump in a taxi.   From the airport you can catch the regular (and inexpensive) no. 35 bus which brings you all the way to the flat in about an hour. SETTLING INTO THE FLAT: I will meet you when you arrive to hand over 2 or 3 sets of keys, show you round the flat and answer any questions you may have about the accommodation, location and Edinburgh in general.  After that you're welcome to call or email if you have any queries or issues but I will leave you to enjoy the flat in private.  You will get my email address when your booking is confirmed, my phone number is on all the key fobs and I live just across the road. I am available 24/7 for emergencies and 11am - 11pm for general questions.
house_rules: NO smoking inside the flat or stairwell. If you have to smoke please go outside. Please check if anyone needs to use the bathroom before taking a bath or shower. Please keep the flat reasonably tidy and do your washing up before leaving. Please be courteous and don't disturb the neighbours or other guests. Report any issues promptly so we can sort them out. Pets are only allowed if cleared with myself in advance, a security deposit is paid and they do not damage anything. If you have problems or questions call me on (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or pop over to see me - I live in the building opposite (182/10 Easter Road). Be nice and enjoy your stay.

Hello, I'm Zeb.

I'm a 38 years old graduate.  I divide my year between organising music festivals, teaching massage and travelling.  When not working I play squash, listen to music, watch movies and read a lot.  Also enjoy DIY and have done a lot of work on my flat over the last few years - it's now a really comfortable place to spend time.  I like my home to be quietly sociable and welcoming, if that sounds good to you please come and stay here.

host_about:
Hi!

About me:

My name is Adam!  I grew up in Scotland so having a laugh is definitely the most important thing to me! I also love meeting new people and sharing past experiences with them which is why I am opening my home to people on airbnb. Some of my closest friendships and also business partnerships  have come from very random circumstances - if you are funny and laid back then we will definitely get on!

I started my career as a surgical doctor before founding a health & fitness tech company. I now live between London and San Francisco. I love to travel and I have been lucky enough to visit some amazing places all over the world. I have to say that  I am very fussy about where I stay, which is why you can be sure that my home is of a high standard! I have set up my home in such a way that people can feel they are in a boutique hotel but also have some important home comforts too. As I travel so much it is the perfect way I would like to visit new places whether I was on a business trip or on holiday! 

About me as a host:

My hosting style is very relaxed and (I like to think) warm and friendly. The Scottish in me really kicks in I think! I look forward to meeting all you fun, interesting people out there and I hope you enjoy the way in which I have adapted my beautiful London Townhouse for you!

Despite being on airbnb for 2 months, I have hosted over 80 times and I have been really grateful to have met so many interesting people. I want to thank my guests for leaving such kind, warm words about me and my home.  Here are a sample of my guest reviews:

"Fabulous 4 (URL HIDDEN) our 50's. Thought it would be hard to give up our 5 star travelling days.But this gorgeous Chiswick English house generated warmth,oozed comfort, and delivered all it said it (URL HIDDEN) added extra was the charm and character of the (URL HIDDEN) nice to feel at ease and welcome.A real bonus to meet other people . Would return in a flash" Georges and Debbie

"Adam's room is even better than what the pictures show, very bright and large and in a very nice neighborhood. The location is great, in a very residential neighborhood, but with many nice restaurants around, and walking distance to the tube station. Also, Adam made me feel very welcome, gave me all the instructions and help needed. Overall, it was a very good experience! Thank you, Adam!" Betina

"Simply the best BNB experience I have had. Large clean rooms in a well organised apartment. Key code worked a dream and so much easier than meeting someone with the key when your phone does not work in that country. Also cheapest apartment in the area so what a deal to find it was a great place all round. Adam was just so friendly and professional. If I lived in that street he would be my new best friend! was a little concerned by a previous post, but I got the story from another guest (who had been there for a month! - thats how good a deal this flat it) and they told me what a nightmare this family had been and how Adam had tried to quieten them down to help the other guests and asked them to clean up their kitchen mess and then they wrote that vicous review!) ANyway, stay here. Easy walk to the Tube, amazing nightlife and real London pubs 1 minute a way, and a perfect BNB Host."

summary: This is a spacious, comfortable double bedroom. It's a cosy room, a warm and pleasant space with touches of luxury. A lovely central location from which to enjoy Edinburgh.
space: THE FLAT: Warm, friendly and relaxed environment. That's the most important thing about this flat; how well those of us who live here get along. Mostly it's quiet, our place away from the rest of the world - we like reading, cooking and watching movies. It's the kind of place where you check if anyone needs to use the bathroom before jumping in the shower for 20 minutes. If that sounds like you please read on... This is a carefully modernised traditional Edinburgh tenement flat built in the 19th century. Its architecture, decor and comfort combine to make this a very homely flat. It boasts many original features including large windows, high ceilings, cornicing, wood panelling and solid wood floors. It also offers modern creature comforts such as temperature-controlled gas central heating, unlimited hot water, double glazing, modern fitted kitchen and good quality furniture. I own a few flats and look after a few others for friends but this is a real Edinburgh home, it's my home. I bou

neighborhood_overview: LOCATION: Easter Road is great neighbourhood that i've seen go from strength to strength over the last decade. Close to the city centre but with its own identity and community. In the immediate vicinity we have the best Italian restaurant, best bakery, best off-license, my favourite pub and the best Thai food i've eaten since Bangkok. There are cool cafes, vintage shops and an award-winning local supermarket (as well a choice of big supermarkets slightly further away, perhaps 10 minutes walk). The flat is central enough that many guests walk everywhere. You will find high street shopping, restaurants, pubs, historic tourist attractions and the picturesque walks that Edinburgh is famed for. PLACES OF INTEREST: The Royal Mile is less than 1 mile away, it is the heart of Edinburgh's old town. It links Holyrood Palace (the Queen's official residence in Scotland) and the Scottish Parliament with Edinburgh Castle. Halfway up is a section called High Street which is the epicentre of street th
notes: DISCOUNTS Some discounts are applied automatically. For example, if you stay for a week you get one night free and if you stay for a month you get 1 week free. AirBnB's system is good but not perfect so I have to apply some discounts manually. In particular if more than 1 person stays in this room for a week or more then I will manually apply a discount to the price you are quoted. When you enquire about renting this room I will send you a special offer with the correct price.
transit: PUBLIC TRANSPORT: Edinburgh is a small city so many guests find they can walk everywhere they wish to visit. However, if you prefer public transport or wish to visit the attractions on Edinburgh's outskirts (such as Rosslyn, Cramond and Portobello) then a close by bus route will take you there. The buses are now GPS tracked with arrival boards at the stops and you can even download a free app to your phone to see exactly how soon the next one is arriving.
access: CAPACITY: This listing is for a private room with a double bed which will sleep 2 people comfortably.
interaction: ARRIVING: The flat is about a mile from Waverley Train Station; you can walk, catch the no.1 bus or jump in a taxi. From the airport you can catch the regular (and inexpensive) no. 35 bus which brings you all the way to the flat in about an hour. SETTLING INTO THE FLAT: I will meet you when you arrive to hand over a set of keys, show you round the flat and answer any questions you may have about the accommodation, location and Edinburgh in general. After that, well I live here so ask questions when you see me or call if i'm out. You will get my email address when your booking is confirmed and my phone number is on all the key fobs.
house_rules: NO smoking inside the flat or stairwell.  If you have to smoke please go outside. Please check if anyone needs to use the bathroom before taking a shower. No shoes on the bedroom carpet or living room rug please. Please keep communal areas tidy, especially the kitchen:  Wipe surfaces, put dirty dishes in the dish-washer and wash pots, etc. Please be courteous and don't disturb the neighbours or other guests. Feel free to play CDs and enjoy the home cinema.  Please put CDs away carefully.  And DO NOT touch the turntable or vinyl. Pets are only allowed if cleared with myself in advance, a security deposit is paid and they do not damage anything. Report any issues promptly so I can sort them out, my phone number is on the key fob.
host_about:
Hello, I'm Zeb.

I'm a 38 years old graduate.  I divide my year between organising music festivals, teaching massage and travelling.  When not working I play squash, listen to music, watch movies and read a lot.  Also enjoy DIY and have done a lot of work on my flat over the last few years - it's now a really comfortable place to spend time.  I like my home to be quietly sociable and welcoming, if that sounds good to you please come and stay here.

neighborhood_overview: Leith. Got to love it. It's just off from the main centre of the city, lots of mixed shops from previous waves of migrants to the city nearby if you like cooking, and one of the main public transport arteries that take you throughout the city.  Some micro-brewery hipster bars on the Walk, and some 'traditional' ones with cheaper beer and thicker Scottish accents at the Foot of it. Some restaurants as well, but I don't eat out much (prefer cooking) so unsure what's good. Centre of the city is at the top of my street. (Princess Street)
notes: There is a half Scottish wildcat! I will check with you, but be warned probably not suitable if you have allergies. Also, be careful of your black clothing - he is incredibly fluffy. host_about:
Hello, I'm Niamh.
I fell in love with Edinburgh 10 years ago and love it even more now.
So what's to love about Edinburgh and Scotland, beautiful buildings, amazing scenery, quirky cafes and shops, great night life with great restaurants and usually a gig somewhere. Lots to see with museums, galleries and historical sights and the odd dormant volcano that might be a good spot for a picnic. 
There really is something for everyone.
Festival time is when the city really comes to life with the largest arts festival in the world a fantastic experience.
I love to travel and know what a difference having a comfortable and homely place to stay can make to a break away, so with that in mind I hope my apartment would have everything you need to make your stay enjoyable and I am here should you need anything during your stay x enjoy Edinburgh!

Hi, thanks for taking the time to look through our rooms.  

I am an Edinburgh native and have lived in an around Joppa for most of my life.  I love the sea air, the local community, which combined give Joppa a very local feel but none-the-less minutes from the city centre. 
For those travelling by road we are just of the main city by pass and the A1 to the east of the city.  Joppa and Portobello are well sign posted so you shouldn’t have any trouble, however if you do feel free to call.  

I particular enjoy the Air B&B experience given the diversity of people it allows me to meet.  I am passionate about my hometown and all too happy to offer up advice, guidance and support for anyone wishing to travel here irrespective if you are staying with me.

Outside the peak season, I am also happy to cater for those on short to long-term work commitments.  Please call to discuss opportunities we may have.

neighborhood_overview: LOCATION: Marchmont Crescent is a quiet residential street just away from the main roads of Marchmont.  It is great neighbourhood and understandable one of the most desirable parts of Edinburgh.  Close to the city centre but with its own identity and community.   There's a Scotmid (which is the Scottish version of Co-op supermarket) 50m away. Just across the road from that is a great pub called the Earl of Marchmont which occasionally and quietly hosts some famous faces from the tele.  Also close by is a hardware store - very useful if you've got a show. There are loads of fruit and veg shops, the area is known for the having the best fresh produce in Edinburgh.  If that's not your thing then there are also pizza, fish n chips, Chinese and Indian take aways. And Sweet Melinda's is a decent restaurant well worth visiting. The flat is central enough that many guests walk everywhere.  You will find high street shopping, restaurants, pubs, historic tourist attractions and the picturesque w
notes: DISCOUNTS & CHARGES Some discounts are applied automatically.  For example, if you stay for a week you get 30% discount and if you stay for a month you 45% discount.  AirBnB's system is good but not perfect so I have to apply some discounts manually.  In particular if more than 6 people people stay in this flat for a week or more then I will manually apply a discount to the price you are quoted.   When you enquire about renting this flat I will send you a special offer with the correct price.  Similarly, if you want an extra bed and bedding to be provided beyond the 4 included beds there is a one-off charge that I will apply manually.  Regardless the length of your stay an extra single bed and bedding costs £15 while a double bed and bedding costs £25.
transit: PUBLIC TRANSPORT: Edinburgh is a small city so many guests find they can walk everywhere they wish to visit.  However, if you prefer public transport or wish to visit the attractions on Edinburgh's outskirts (such as Rosslyn, Cramond and Portobello) then a close by bus route will take you there.  The buses are now GPS tracked with arrival boards at the stops and you can even download a free app to your phone to see exactly how soon the next one is arriving.
access: CAPACITY: This listing is for the whole flat which has 3 dedicated bedrooms with proper beds for 6 people. The small living room will fit a single bed easily or a double if required.  Extra beds and bedding can be provided for a small additional fee. This allows up to 7 or 8 people to stay in the flat comfortably.  However the big front bedroom can be a triple or even quadruple so if the single bathroom isn't a problem for you then 9 or possibly 10 people could stay.
interaction: ARRIVING: The flat is just over a mile from both Waverley and Haymarket Train Stations; you can walk, catch the no.5 bus from the former or jump in a taxi.   From the airport you can catch the regular (and inexpensive) no. 35 bus to Lauriston Place which is 0.5 mile away.  Get off at and walk along Middle Meadow Walk. Or catch the Express 100 bus to either train station. SETTLING INTO THE FLAT: I will meet you when you arrive to hand over 3 sets of keys, show you round the flat and answer any questions you may have about the accommodation, location and Edinburgh in general.  After that you're welcome to call or email if you have any queries or issues but I will leave you to enjoy the flat in private.  You will get my email address when your booking is confirmed and my phone number is on all the key fobs. I am available 24/7 for emergencies and 11am - 11pm for general questions.
house_rules: Please be courteous to neighbours and other guests. Absolutely NO smoking inside the building (there is a garden). Please keep the flat reasonably tidy and do your washing up before leaving. Report any issues promptly so we can sort them out. There is only one bathroom so please check if anyone needs to use it before jumping in the shower. And do enjoy Edinburgh.

space: Bed and breakfast at 11 Ravelston Dykes with 4 rooms to rent out is an amazing opportunity to sample one of the most cultured and beautiful cities in the world. CarMichael is a family owned guest house. Caroline Johnstone is ready to give you a warm welcome when you come to share the relaxed atmosphere and warm hospitality of her home. Welcome to 11 Ravelston Dykes ;- Magnificent detached home in Murrayfield area sits in a large south facing garden.  Its a quiet location and yet  only 15 minutes walk to the West End of Edinburgh, 10 mins walk to Haymarket railway station, 10 minutes to Murrayfield stadium, and 5 mins walk to two major Edinburgh Art Galleries - the Dean and the Gallery of Modern Art. The water of Leith is very close also for beautiful walks. There is free car parking and wifi internet throughout the house.  All rooms have central heating, tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer, freeview in bedrooms and cable tv in master family room. Guest fridge in dining room. Ro

Bed and breakfast at 11 Ravelston Dykes with 4 rooms to rent out is an amazing opportunity to sample one of the most cultured and beautiful cities in the world. CarMichael is a family owned guest house. Caroline Johnstone is ready to give you a warm welcome when you come to share the relaxed atmosphere and warm hospitality of her home. Welcome to 11 Ravelston Dykes ;- Magnificent detached home in Murrayfield area sits in a large south facing garden.  Its a quiet location and yet  only 15 minutes walk to the West End of Edinburgh, 10 mins walk to Haymarket railway station, 10 minutes to Murrayfield stadium, and 5 mins walk to two major Edinburgh Art Galleries - the Dean and the Gallery of Modern Art. The water of Leith is very close also for beautiful walks.
neighborhood_overview: Being very near to the city centre we are close to all Edinburgh has to offer.  The bars and restaurants of George Street and Edinburghs infamous Princes Street are a mere 15 minutes walk away. There are many beautiful walks along the water of Leith. Two major Art Galleries within 5 minutes walk, 15 minutes walk to West End and Princes Street,  Murrayfield rugby stadium and Edinburgh Zoo are both 10 minutes walk away.  If walking is not your thing then take advantage of the multiple transport links that are on the doorstep.
notes: Edinburgh and Scotland offer a variety of attractions to suit all interests. Scotlands capital is one of the most beautiful cities in Europe and its ancient castle, historic old town, pubs and restaurants, theatres and many festivals are only a stones throw away from CarMichael Guest House. For the travellers in you the Scottish Highlands are within a few hours drive from the city and the East coast offers an abundance of some of the best golf courses in Scotland.
transit: The airport travel link stops 10 minutes walk from the house and we are close to both rail links and the Edinburgh International Conference Centre.  Bus stop is outside the house for getting into the city centre.
access: Guests will have access to the dining room/sitting room. Dining room has a fridge for guests use.
interaction: As much or as little as they want.  I can give advice on pubs, restaurants, attractions, transport, sporting activities etc
house_rules: No smoking please.
host_about: I love all kinds of sports particularly golf and keeping fit.  I love the outdoor life and walking my dog. I like horse riding although I do not own a horse any longer. I love children and meeting new people. I love a challenge and live life to the full. My motto is  "Be the best you can be"

host_about:
Hi Im Hamish from Haggis Hostels.
I am in West Register Street, Edinburgh. I offer travellers clean, comfortable, affordable city centre accommodation..

I am only a few paces from Princess Street, and walking distance from both Waverley train station and St Andrews Square bus station.
My newly renovated hostel is spotlessly clean and fresh. 

Fitted out with the traveller in mind I have had universal plug sockets fitted so no need for travel adaptors.
I also have black out blinds in all my rooms to ensure a good nights sleep. 

I have brand new solid pine beds.
Hotel standard Larger mattresses and high quality FREE linen.

All showers are new Mira Power showers. 24 hour hot showers.
All rooms have a fully working opening window.
All rooms are bright and airy.
All rooms are newly decorated.
All rooms are carpeted throughout.

My guest's have commented that I have THE BEST hostel showers they have experienced.

I provide a light breakfast FREE of charge with FREE tea and coffee facilities available all day
I have the cleanest hostel in Edinburgh! 

Cancellation policy
We usually operate a 48 hours cancellation policy although for special events or group bookings please refer to website.
All bookings cancelled more than 48 hours prior to arrival will incur a 10% administration fee or a minimum of £5.00 whichever is the greater. This fee is per booking. All bookings cancelled after 48 hours prior to scheduled arrival or no shows will be charged in full.

host_about:
Hi, thanks for taking the time to look through our rooms.  

I am an Edinburgh native and have lived in an around Joppa for most of my life.  I love the sea air, the local community, which combined give Joppa a very local feel but none-the-less minutes from the city centre. 
For those travelling by road we are just of the main city by pass and the A1 to the east of the city.  Joppa and Portobello are well sign posted so you shouldn’t have any trouble, however if you do feel free to call.  

I particular enjoy the Air B&B experience given the diversity of people it allows me to meet.  I am passionate about my hometown and all too happy to offer up advice, guidance and support for anyone wishing to travel here irrespective if you are staying with me.

Outside the peak season, I am also happy to cater for those on short to long-term work commitments.  Please call to discuss opportunities we may have.

name: Double Bedroom in Edinburgh Flat-Share
summary: I live alone in a 2 bedroom flat and have one double bedroom available for guests. The flat has a shared bathroom with bath/shower/toilet etc., a shared kitchen with oven, microwave, cooker, toaster, kettle, etc., a large shared living/dining room.
space: I have a nice flat in an old tenement building with good neighbours, good local amenities, and most standard facilities you'll need in the flat itself. It has a nice, average size bathroom and kitchen, as well as a large living/dining room, which you're free to use as much as you like. I have a 42" TV, but it's not connected to an aerial - I only use it as a monitor and for the Xbox360. The 360 has two hard drives connected with lots of movies and tv shows which you're welcome to watch. You're also welcome to hook up your laptop, and can of course make use of the unlimited 50Mbps wi-fi internet connection. You're welcome to eat and drink at the flat, as long as you don't get too carried away! I don't have any pets, but you're welcome to bring your own, as long as you're confident they'll behave themselves! Please just let me know in advance.

neighborhood_overview: The flat is in Leith, a 2 minute walk away from the Ocean Terminal shopping centre and bus terminus. The Shore is also close - a 10 minute walk away, and has lots of great bars and restaurants in a lovely part of town. The water of Leith runs past the area, a 2 minute walk away from the flat. The flat is on the top floor of an old (B-listed) tenement building.
notes: I realise the price is quite high - this is just because I value my space and really only expect to take bookings during busy periods. For the sake of expectation management, based on feedback I've received, I'll also point out that due to the age of the building, the stair well isn't much to look at. It's tidy and everything - just old! Also, the guest bedroom does have curtains, but they still let in quite a lot of light in the mornings. Other than that, I'm sure you'll be very comfortable.
transit: I can recommend a very reliable local taxi company, but the bus connections are also very convenient. Being close to Ocean Terminal, the flat is: 1 minute walk to numbers 10 and 34 buses 2 minute walk to numbers 16, 22, 35 and 36 buses 4 minute walk to numbers 7, 14 and 21 buses There is also a free parking area next to the building.
access: You'll have unlimited access to your double bedroom, hallway, bathroom, kitchen and dining/living room, although you'll be sharing all of these but the bedroom with me. Once you "check in" and get keys, you can come and go as you like, but if you want to "check in" during business hours, I'll need you to meet me at my office 10 minutes away.
interaction: I work a 10 minute walk away from the flat, Mon-Fri 9am-5:30pm. I'll be available on my mobile in case of emergency, and will be around the flat most evenings/weekends. I'll probably mostly keep to myself, but I'll be available a lot of the time if you need anything, and am happy to help you get orientated and recommend good places to go for food/drinks etc.
house_rules: Come and go as you like - please just keep the noise down after 11pm (12 at weekends), clean up any kitchenware you use, don't bring anyone to the flat other than the agreed/booked guests, make sure the bathroom is free between 7:40-8am every week day, and generally try to be respectful of the place.

name: Bright  Clean  Double Room  Ensuite
space: A lovely bright and clean double room with Ensuite available for your stay in Edinburgh. The great sized room benefits from comfortable double bed, draws and wardrobe space, plus towels and bed linen, plus access to your own private ensuite. There is also access to  modern kitchen, which you are free to use as you please. The price also includes free parking and wireless internet.  Getting to the city centre could not be easier, there many direct bus routes getting you to the city centre in around 20 minutes. And if you feel like stretching your legs getting to the city centre by walking will take 45 mins.  You will also find a great shopping centre close by to the property. We look forward to giving you tips on the best places to go and look forward to welcoming you great home!
